content: to indicate the thumb thumb knitting needle and cast off in 1x1 rib yarn any fingering weight yarn no more gusset than 50g / 200m of the main colour and less than 5g / 20m of each contrast with your 2 5mm dpns & main colour pick weave in all ends i d recommend you colour on row 6 9 12 15 18 21 24 27 & 30 up the 12 cast-on stitches on your first reinforce the corners where the thumb you ll be increasing using m1l & m1r these needle on your second needle pick up 12 grows from the body needles etc are done within the thumb gusset after all of of the stitches on the waste yarn on your 2 5mm dpns or circular for ribbing the increases you will have 72 stitches in third needle pick up the remaining 12 you work 2 mittens the same there s no right dpns advised for thumb ribbing total 24 between each stitch marker have 36 stitches or left 3mm dpns/circular for body 2 5mm crochet hook optional tip when working the chart i used the one leg below method to even out the pattern when working the main colour row stitch markers directly after the stranded row lift the right leg of the stitch below this link helps explain it better
